DrugName: Pain relievers such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen to manage pain and discomfort
Muscle relaxants like cyclobenzaprine or metaxalone for shoulder muscle relaxation
Antihypertensive medications like losartan or amlodipine to control blood pressure
Renal protective agents such as ACE inhibitors (e.g., enalapril) or ARBs (e.g., valsartan) considering the patient's renal insufficiency and history of acute on chronic renal failure
Blood thinners like aspirin to prevent clotting in case of potential future surgeries
Antianemic medications such as epoetin alfa or darbepoetin alfa for managing anemia
Opioid analgesics like oxycodone or hydrocodone with acetaminophen for severe pain management (as a last resort and under close medical supervision)
Proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) like omeprazole to prevent stress ulcer prophylaxis due to renal insufficiency
Antacids such as ranitidine for acid reflux or dyspepsia
Iron supplements like ferrous sulfate if necessary, depending on patient's anemia management
